definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: Before the economic reforms, Beijing's largest department store was the Wangfujing Hundred Goods Emporium.
sentences.chinese: 改革开放以前，北京最大的商店就是王府井百货大楼。

sentences.english: I will be working in the department store next month.
sentences.chinese: 下个月我将在这个百货大楼里上班。

sentences.english: Keep going until you come to a department store. You can't miss it.
sentences.chinese: 往前一直走到百货大楼，你不会找不到的。

sentences.english: Advertisement papers were sent around the department papers were sent around the department store.
sentences.chinese: 在百货大楼周围散发了广告传单。

sentences.english: Could you accompany me to the department store some time this week?
sentences.chinese: 您本周什么时间有空能陪我去百货大楼一趟吗？

definition: Friendship Store, PRC state-run store originally intended for foreigners, diplomats etc, specializing in selling imported Western goods and quality Chinese crafts
Xinhua Bookstore, China's largest bookstore chain
shopping mall/shopping center/department store/emporium/CL:家[jia1]/the business world
Nanjing St., large commercial street in Shanghai
